title: Ghana's Kojo Marfo: Sell-out show for butcher-turned-painter
description: He's got rock star fans and two sold-out shows to his name, but Kojo Marfo prefers life's simple joys.

title: Nadiya Hussain: 'I've wanted to bleach the brown out of me'
description: Nadiya Hussain talks to comedian Ali Shahalom about being British Bangladeshi in 2021.

title: Why people in Eswatini are calling for change
description: Dozens of people have died in recent protests calling for reform of Eswatini's absolute monarchy.

title: How your driving might reveal early signs of Alzheimer's
description: Research shows how small changes in the way you drive could expose preclinical signs of disease.

title: Bank scammer threatens BBC reporter over the phone
description: A fraudster threatens a BBC reporter during a call supposedly from his bank after a text scam.

title: The EU countries 'pushing back' asylum seekers at sea
description: Greece is accused of sending thousands back to Turkey without allowing them to apply for asylum.

title: Flash floods in parts of London leaves cars submerged as roads fill with water
description: Heavy rain has caused flash floods in parts of London, leaving cars submerged and roads filled with water.

title: England 'must be let off the leash'
description: After losing the Euro 2020 final on penalties to Italy, BBC Sport's Phil McNulty looks at how manager Gareth Southgate can take England to the next step.

title: Capitol riots: What we have learned six months on
description: Arrests and probes continue as some conservatives seek to cast 6 January in a different light.

title: UK bans fifth neo-Nazi group under terror laws
description: US group The Base, which aims to start a race war, is banned after recruitment efforts in Britain.

title: FA review after fans break into Wembley for final
description: The FA chief executive Mark Bullingham apologises to legitimate fans whose experience was affected.

title: Euro champions land in Rome to scenes of jubilation
description: The Italian football team arrived in Rome to scores of ecstatic fans and choruses of applause.

title: Euro 2020: Why abuse remains rife on social media
description: Racist abuse aimed at football players following Sunday's tournament finale has been widely condemned.

title: Racist abuse of players 'unforgiveable' says Southgate
description: England manager Gareth Southgate says online racist abuse of Marcus Rashford, Jadon Sancho and Bukayo Saka is "unforgiveable", after Prime Minister Boris Johnson and the FA condemn the social media posts.

title: Covid-19: PM urges caution as 19 July unlocking set to go ahead
description: Boris Johnson warns that Covid cases, currently at 30,000 a day, will rise as restrictions end.

title: Jaipur: Lightning strike kills 16 taking selfies in India
description: The incident happened when tourists were at a popular fort in the northern city of Jaipur.

title: Euro 2020 final: TV audience peaked at 31m as England lost on penalties
description: It's the most viewed event since the funeral of Diana, Princess of Wales in 1997, seen by 32.1m.

title: Marcus Rashford mural defaced after England Euro 2020 defeat
description: The artwork honouring the footballer's work to tackle child food poverty is vandalised.

title: Gareth Southgate: England boss hopes to lead team at 2022 Qatar World Cup
description: Gareth Southgate hopes to lead England at the 2022 World Cup but says he needs a rest before considering contract talks.

title: Super Mario 64 game sells for record-breaking $1.5m at auction
description: An original Zelda cartridge and a Mario game set successive records at auction within days.

title: Euro 2020 final: England boss Gareth Southgate says he chose penalty-takers
description: All too aware of the pain of a penalty miss, England boss Gareth Southgate rallied around the trio who missed theirs in the Euro 2020 final.

title: Euro 2020: What lessons can England and Gareth Southgate learn from final defeat?
description: BBC Sport pundits Rio Ferdinand, Alan Shearer and Frank Lampard analyse Gareth Southgate's tactics in the wake of their penalty shootout defeat by Italy in the Euro 2020 final.

title: In pictures: Joy and sorrow over Euro 2020 final
description: High hopes and nerves give way to sorrow as England lose to Italy on penalties.

title: Euro 2020: Watch the BBC's closing montage for England's emotional run to the final
description: Watch the BBC's closing montage for our coverage of Euro 2020, focusing on England's emotional run the final where they fell agonisingly short of a first European Championship.

title: Murray leads Lions for first time against South Africa A
description: Tour captain Conor Murray leads the British and Irish Lions for the first time when they face South Africa A in Cape Town on Wednesday.

title: Daily Mail: Rothermere family considers bid to take news group private
description: The family, which owns 28% of the group, is looking to buy the rest of the news organisation.

title: Euro 2020: Italy fans ecstatic after England defeated in Wembley final
description: The Italian team is given a hero's welcome as it arrives home after defeating England on penalties.

title: Florida breaks manatee death record in first six months of 2021
description: Wildlife authorities say the unprecedented number of deaths was primarily caused by starvation.

title: McGregor 'feeling tremendous' after surgery and promises to return 'better than ever'
description: Conor McGregor promises to come back "better than ever" after having surgery on a broken leg sustained in defeat by Dustin Poirier.

title: How the Euro 2020 final brought this Oldham community together
description: The BBC's Ed Thomas spends Euro 2020 final day on an estate in Oldham, Greater Manchester.

title: 'I'm no Michael Jordan' - Antetokounmpo shines in crucial NBA Finals win
description: Giannis Antetokounmpo plays down comparisons to Michael Jordan after a historic display in game three of the NBA Finals.

title: 'Not seeing my disabled son during lockdown was awful'
description: Dawn Cavanagh says Jack, who lives in residential care, phoned her saying "mummy, come and get me".

title: The Papers: 'Lions did us proud' and 'curse strikes again'
description: Monday's papers reflect a nation's heartbreak after England's Euro 2020 final defeat.

title: Euro 2020 final: Italy manager Roberto Mancini says 'I was due this'
description: Italy manager Roberto Mancini says "I was due this" after his side beat England on penalties to win Euro 2020.

title: England's Euro 2020: 'They brought us joy that my generation have never felt'
description: BBC pundits react to England's Euro 2020 final defeat by Italy after penalty shootout heartbreak at Wembley.
